item.title: runconf18
item.description: Worked on this package at @rOpenSci’s 2018 Unconf.

item.title: how I organise my thoughts and time
item.description: my current systems Updated: 2018-08-15 I wonder if all or some of this should move to the dontpanic readme. pieces piano practice/task switching/pomodoor bullet journal, used to be as portable as possible blog to see if I’ve made any progress on my study problems for today, to track my productivity system, and to learn about my research problems; in short, blog for me, don’t worry about anyone else: but keep it to those three categories; one category per post, etc.

item.title: measures.
item.description: I like Newport’s term deep work. How I’m going today: Table 1: today’s goals type poms goal success phi 0 4 FALSE phi 3 4 FALSE theta 0 4 FALSE theta 4 4 TRUE varphi 1 4 FALSE varphi 4 4 TRUE ## Warning: Removed 15 rows containing missing values (geom_point). (#tab:recent observations)Most recent observations. date daily_review food mood phi theta varphi pom goals phi_goal theta_goal varphi_goal soundtrack yoga or walk phase physical smoking 2018-08-05 started meh okay 4 2 2 20 4 poms per day each 4 4 4 film NA operation dumpsterfire this is what dying feels like NA 2018-08-06 started meh okay 4 1 1 20 complete goals 4 4 4 film NA operation dumpsterfire this is what dying feels like NA 2018-08-07 started good okay 1 2 4 20 complete projects 4 4 4 film NA operation dumpsterfire still a bit sick NA 2018-08-13 started good not great 4 1 3 20 complete projects 4 4 4 film yoga operation dumpsterfire: overdrive hale non smoker 2018-08-14 started meh not great 0 0 1 20 complete projects 4 4 4 film walk operation dumpsterfire: overdrive hale smoker 2018-08-15 started fine not great 3 4 4 20 complete projects 4 4 4 film yoga operation dumpsterfire: overdrive hungover smoker

item.title: news
item.description: events in 2018 event date role Evidence Synthesis Hackathon La Trobe University Choose Maths day June 4 10 minute speech to school children about the Japanese concept of ikigai and how I find ikigai in practicing mathematical science and a panel session Q & A. useR! 2018
